head.title: Poland's Ex-Premier Picked as Party Leader

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: Poland's Ex-Premier Picked as Party Leader

block.p: Jozef Oleksy, who resigned this week as Prime Minister of Poland over charges that he once spied for Moscow, was chosen today to lead the Social Democrats, the former Comunist party, a party official said.

The official, Robert Dobrzynski, said that party members gave Mr. Oleksy 308 votes out of a total of 325, to lead the Social Democrats, the core faction of the Democratic Left Alliance, a coalition that also the Peasant party. The two groups are locked in talks over who should fill the top posts in a reshuffled Cabinet prompted by Mr. Oleksy's resignation on Wednesday.

Jozef Oleksy, who resigned this week as Prime Minister of Poland over charges that he once spied for Moscow, was chosen today to lead the Social Democrats, the former Comunist party, a party official said.

The official, Robert Dobrzynski, said that party members gave Mr. Oleksy 308 votes out of a total of 325, to lead the Social Democrats, the core faction of the Democratic Left Alliance, a coalition that also the Peasant party. The two groups are locked in talks over who should fill the top posts in a reshuffled Cabinet prompted by Mr. Oleksy's resignation on Wednesday.
Mr. Oleksy is now heading a caretaker Government during the two weeks the Constitution allows for a new Prime Minister to be named.

Mr. Oleksy has firmly denied charges by Poland's security service that he was a spy and that the allegations stem from claims by Government agents working on behalf of former President Lech Walesa, who was defeated by Aleksander Kwasniewski, also a former Communist, in presidential elections on Nov. 19.
